Name: Malabari Fish Curry
Description: sear fish, coconut, ginger, pureed tamarind, salt, powdered turmeric, green chillies, red chilli powder, shallots

Name: Japanese Fish Stew
Description: sole fillet (you can also do 2/3 types of fish), large shrimps (optional), potatoes (peeled), onions (cut into slices), garlic cloves, red capsicum (can use green also), parsley or coriander (choose the herb that most suits your taste buds), few dashes of hot sauce, paprika, olive oil, white wine, rock salt

Name: Malabar Fish Curry
Description: whole coriander seeds, whole red chilli, coconut oil, mustard seeds, onion, curry leaf, coconut milk, tamarind pulp, coriander, seabass fish curry cuts

Name: Surmai Curry with Lobster Butter Rice
Description: tamarind, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, salt, fresh coconut, onion, garlic cloves, coriander seeds, fenugreek seeds, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, tamarind (lemon sized), butter, lobster (de-shell and devein and make a small cube), salt and lime, surmai

Name: Seared Salmon in Tabasco Butter
Description: butter, tabasco, chives, salt, salmon fillet, olive oil, sea salt

Name: Risotto Lobster
Description: lobster shell, carrot, leeks, garlic cloves, tomato paste, bay leaf, peppercorn, water, lobster meat, arborio rice, onion, leeks, lobster stock, parmesan cheese, cream, salt, olive oil, egg, parmesan, flour, milk, parsley, salt, cherry tomatoes, garlic pods, olive oil, water, oil, flour, salt

Name: Red Sauce Pasta
Description: Pasta cooked with a rich and tangy tomato-based sauce, typically seasoned with garlic, onions, basil, and oregano. Often includes vegetables, meat, or seafood.

Name: White Sauce Pasta
Description: Pasta served with a creamy and smooth white sauce made from butter, flour, and milk or cream. Commonly seasoned with garlic, pepper, and cheese. Can include vegetables, chicken, or seafood.

Name: Sauteed Vegetables
Description: A medley of fresh vegetables quickly cooked in a small amount of oil or butter until tender but still crisp. Seasoned with herbs and spices to enhance their natural flavors.

Name: Boiled Eggs
Description: Eggs that are cooked in their shells in boiling water until the whites and yolks have solidified. A versatile and protein-rich food that can be eaten on its own or used in various dishes.

Name: Protein Shake
Description: A nutritious beverage made by blending protein powder with milk or a milk substitute, and often including fruits, nuts, or other ingredients to enhance flavor and nutritional value. Ideal for post-workout recovery.

Description: none

Name: Lebanese Bread

Name: Grilled Kofta
Description: Minced meat (usually beef or lamb) mixed with spices, onions, and herbs, shaped onto skewers, and grilled to perfection. Often served with pita bread, salads, and dips.

Name: Koshary
Description: A popular Egyptian street food made with a mix of rice, lentils, pasta, chickpeas, and topped with a spicy tomato sauce and crispy fried onions.

Name: Mahshy
Description: Stuffed vegetables such as grape leaves, zucchini, or peppers, filled with a mix of rice, herbs, and sometimes meat.

Name: Ful Medames
Description: A traditional Egyptian dish of cooked fava beans served with olive oil, chopped parsley, onion, garlic, and lemon juice.

Name: Molokhia
Description: A green soup made from finely chopped jute leaves, often flavored with garlic and coriander, and served with rice or bread.

Name: Egyptian Taro Meal (Kolkas)
Description: Kolkas is a traditional Egyptian dish made from taro root, which is peeled, cubed, and cooked in a savory broth, garlic, and coriander. It is often prepared with pieces of meat or chicken for added flavor and nutrition. This hearty and flavorful dish is typically served with rice or bread.

Name: Taameya
Description: A deep-fried ball or patty made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both, mixed with herbs and spices.

Name: Fattah
Description: A layered dish consisting of rice, crispy bread, and meat, all topped with a garlic vinegar sauce and tomato sauce.

Name: Hummus
Description: A creamy spread made from mashed chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic. It's a popular dip in Middle Eastern cuisine.

Name: Baba Ganoush
Description: A smoky, creamy dip made from roasted eggplants, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, and garlic.

Name: Shish Tawook
Description: Marinated chicken skewers that are grilled to perfection, often served with garlic sauce and pita bread.

Name: Meat Shawarma
Description: A popular Middle Eastern street food consisting of marinated and slow-cooked meat (usually beef or lamb) that's been cooked on a rotisserie and served in a pita or flatbread with vegetables and sauces.

Name: Chicken Shawarma
Description: A popular Middle Eastern street food consisting of marinated and slow-cooked chicken that's been cooked on a rotisserie and served in a pita or flatbread with vegetables and sauces.

Name: Mansaf
Description: A traditional Jordanian dish made of lamb cooked in a fermented dried yogurt sauce and served with rice or bulgur.

Name: Kibbeh
Description: A dish made of bulgur, minced onions, and finely ground lean beef, lamb, goat, or camel meat with Middle Eastern spices.

Name: Mutabbal
Description: A dip made from roasted eggplants, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil, similar to Baba Ganoush but often with more tahini.

Name: Fattoush
Description: A fresh and crunchy salad made from mixed greens and vegetables, toasted or fried pieces of pita bread, and a zesty lemon vinaigrette.
